filmography.title: The Seventh Cross
filmography.role_description: The loyal wife of a man who risks his life to hide an escapee from a Nazi concentration camp; a significant early Hollywood role.
filmography.plot: Seven men escape from a Nazi concentration camp, and the commandant vows to execute them all on seven crosses.

filmography.title: The Valley of Decision
filmography.role_description: A snobbish socialite who competes with a housemaid (Greer Garson) for the affection of a steel mill owner's son.
filmography.plot: A maid in a Pittsburgh steel family's home falls for the owner's son, bridging the gap between the workers and the owners.

filmography.title: The Green Years
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a Scottish family who helps raise an Irish orphan sent to live with them.
filmography.plot: An Irish orphan is sent to live with his relatives in Scotland, where he struggles to find his path in life and love.

filmography.title: Dragonwyck
filmography.role_description: The deformed, physically challenged maid and friend to the protagonist in this gothic thriller.
filmography.plot: A simple country girl marries a wealthy distant cousin and moves into his gloomy mansion, where she discovers his madness.

filmography.title: Forever Amber
filmography.role_description: The long-suffering maid and confidante to the ambitious Amber St. Clare in this scandalous period drama.
filmography.plot: In 17th-century England, an ambitious woman sleeps her way to the top of society but loses the only man she truly loves.

filmography.title: A Woman's Vengeance
filmography.role_description: A bitter, spinsterish woman who is secretly in love with a married man and becomes a suspect when his wife dies.
filmography.plot: A man is accused of poisoning his invalid wife so he can marry a younger woman, but the truth is more complex.

filmography.title: September Affair
filmography.role_description: The estranged wife of an engineer who believes he died in a plane crash, while he starts a new life in Italy.
filmography.plot: Two lovers meet in Italy and decide to start a new life together after they are mistakenly listed as dead in a plane crash.

filmography.title: The Desert Fox: The Story of Rommel
filmography.role_description: The devoted wife of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel, who supports him as he grows disillusioned with Hitler.
filmography.plot: The story of the final years of Erwin Rommel, focusing on his military campaigns and his conflict with the Nazi regime.

filmography.title: The Light in the Forest
filmography.role_description: The biological mother of a white boy raised by Native Americans, who struggles to reconnect with her son when he is returned.
filmography.plot: A white boy raised by Native Americans is forced to return to his biological family, leading to a clash of cultures.

filmography.title: The Birds
filmography.role_description: A possessive, widowed mother who fears losing her son to a new girlfriend amidst terrifying bird attacks.
filmography.plot: A wealthy San Francisco socialite pursues a potential boyfriend to a small Northern California town that slowly takes a turn for the bizarre when birds of all kinds suddenly begin to attack people.

filmography.title: Butley
filmography.role_description: A literature professor who clashes with the title character in this film adaptation of the Simon Gray play.
filmography.plot: A professor at a London university has a day where his professional and personal life completely unravels.

filmography.title: Honky Tonk Freeway
filmography.role_description: An elderly woman with a drinking problem traveling cross-country with her husband.
filmography.plot: The mayor of a small Florida town bribes officials to get an exit ramp built for his town, leading to a chaotic convergence of travelers.

filmography.title: The World According to Garp
filmography.role_description: The strict, no-nonsense mother of the school nurse (Glenn Close) and grandmother to Garp.
filmography.plot: A struggling young writer finds his life and work dominated by his unfaithful wife and his radical feminist mother.

filmography.title: Still of the Night
filmography.role_description: A psychiatrist's mother who helps him investigate a murder mystery involving one of his patients.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist finds himself falling for a woman who may be the killer of one of his patients.

filmography.title: Best Friends
filmography.role_description: The baffled mother of Burt Reynolds' character who deals with her son's unconventional relationship.
filmography.plot: A pair of professional screenwriters try to make their professional relationship personal by getting married.

filmography.title: The Bostonians
filmography.role_description: An elderly, respected leader of the suffragette movement in 19th-century Boston.
filmography.plot: A Mississippi lawyer and a suffragette compete for the attention and allegiance of a young woman with a special talent for public speaking.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Cocoon
filmography.role_description: A resident of a retirement home who is rejuvenated by alien pods in the swimming pool.
filmography.plot: When a group of trespassing seniors swim in a pool containing alien cocoons, they find themselves energized with youthful vigor.

filmography.title: Foxfire
filmography.role_description: An elderly Appalachian widow who converses with the ghost of her husband while facing pressure to sell her land.
filmography.plot: An elderly widow living in the Blue Ridge Mountains refuses to leave her home and land, despite the concerns of her son.
filmography.awards: Emmy Award: Win – Outstanding Lead Actress

filmography.title: *batteries not included
filmography.role_description: An elderly tenant suffering from dementia who believes the small alien machines saving their building are her family.
filmography.plot: Aliens help a feisty elderly couple protect their home from a ruthless developer.

filmography.title: The House on Carroll Street
filmography.role_description: The wealthy employer of a woman who stumbles upon a McCarthy-era conspiracy.
filmography.plot: A woman blacklisted during the McCarthy era uncovers a plot to smuggle Nazi war criminals into the United States.

filmography.title: Cocoon: The Return
filmography.role_description: Reprising her role as one of the seniors who returns to Earth from the alien planet.
filmography.plot: The seniors who left Earth with the aliens return to visit their families, but discover that their time on Earth is limited.

filmography.title: Driving Miss Daisy
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, stubborn Jewish widow in the South who forms a decades-long friendship with her Black chauffeur; earned her the Oscar at age 80.
filmography.plot: An old Jewish woman and her African-American chauffeur in the American South have a relationship that grows and improves over the years.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress; BAFTA: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: Fried Green Tomatoes
filmography.role_description: A nursing home resident who tells a transformative story of friendship and resilience to a younger, unhappy housewife.
filmography.plot: A housewife who is unhappy with her life befriends an old lady in a nursing home and is enthralled by the tales she tells of people she used to know.

filmography.title: Used People
filmography.role_description: The critical Jewish mother of Shirley MacLaine's character in this romantic comedy-drama.
filmography.plot: At her husband's funeral, a Jewish woman is wooed by an Italian man who has loved her from afar for years.

filmography.title: To Dance with the White Dog
filmography.role_description: The beloved wife whose death prompts her husband to bond with a mysterious stray dog.
filmography.plot: An elderly man grieving the loss of his wife finds comfort in a white dog that only he can see.
filmography.awards: Notable Hallmark Hall of Fame Movie

filmography.title: Nobody's Fool
filmography.role_description: The sharp-witted landlady and friend to Paul Newman's character; one of her final film roles.
filmography.plot: A stubborn man past his prime reflects on his life of strict independence and the people he has kept at a distance.
filmography.awards: Camilla was her last film, this was one of her last great performances.

filmography.title: Camilla
filmography.role_description: An eccentric, violin-playing older woman who embarks on a road trip with a younger musician; Tandy's final film.
filmography.plot: An aspiring composer and an elderly woman take a road trip from Georgia to Toronto to attend a concert.
